Our Airbnb was amazing for me in a way that had nothing to do with the actual accommodations, but the landscape. Being from eastern Kansas I always get a little miffed/defensive when people dismissively talk about Kansas being flat. I’m so quick to assure them it’s not all flat, like that’s a bad thing. This place was FLAT and gorgeous! There had been a lot of rain and a storm the night we were there, so as we left it was a 360 degree green earth against a perfectly even blue sky. Of course puffy clouds everywhere. Over the rainbow country! Flat and fabulous!
Accommodations were nicely country! If you’re not into a country stay, don’t stay here. It will be wasted on you. There is a mile of dirt road so be aware of weather. There was a lot of rain around time we went so quite muddy. Don’t go for the wifi, it’s spotty. Take a break and disconnect. I’m sending my family who travel between Albuquerque and eastern Kansas to stay here.

review_text:
This place was excellent value - it comfortably slept our family of four without feeling like we were on top of each other, and the separate rooms were a welcome change from the four of us all in a shared space for the preceding 6 nights we'd spent on our road trip / vacation. The king-sized bed was exceptionally comfortable and I my only regret was that I had to get out of it in the morning. The kids enjoyed the bunk beds, too. We didn't prepare any extravagant meals while there, but it appeared to have everything one would need for making breakfast, lunch & dinner. The linens provided for bed & bath were also more than adequate for us, and it was nice not having to unpack that which we'd brought with us just for a night.
Overall, definitely recommend a stay here if you happen to be in the area. We were on a trip back home from a couple states west of KS but wanted a change of pace from the same trip out we'd made along I-70. It's 15 minutes (or less) from US-56, 83 & 160, so close enough to any highways you might be traveling, but far enough out that you don't have nosy neighbors. Just a word of warning if you book this place - heed the owner's advice about directions when he sends them to you, since Google seems to have made a mess of how the streets in the area are labeled.
